alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cheyenne, northwestern Thomas, southwestern Rawlins and central Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 1030 PM MDT/1130 PM CDT/... At 958 PM MDT/1058 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking several areas of diminishing thunderstorms. As these storms continue to diminish, wind gusts to 50 mph are expected. Winds will likely increase suddenly. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Cheyenne, northwestern Thomas, southwestern Rawlins and central Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Edson, Blakeman and Beardsley. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 7 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
